page.title: 06Cropwell Bishop Butcher
page.content:
Mr.Harold Barlow owns quite a large field behind his butchers shop in which there are lambs and sheep.Every year in February/March the sheep begin to lamb.They are kept in a warm brick outhouse which is quite small.The Barlows are sometimes up at all hours of the night helping the sheep and lambs.Most people think that lambs are white.True,some breeds are, but this breed has a black face and legs and a greyish-white fleece. The male lambs are killed for meat in Mr. Barlow's own abbatoir ,but the females are left to lamb another year.
{Author:Olivia Corden, aged 11yrs.
